SL v Eng at The Oval

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Ballance c Chandimal b Senanayake 64 (72b 5x4 1x6 93m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: not enough distance this time! Ballance tried to heave this from outside off over one of the long boundaries, but it came off the bottom of the bat and Chandimal had plenty of time to steady under the catch at deep midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c Malinga b Mathews 50 (56b 4x4 1x6 88m) SR: 89.28

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball, Bell sits back for it and swings leg side but swings it straight to short long leg where Malinga takes an easy catch. A poor dismissal from Bell's point of view not getting the elevation on a ball that was there to hit but he picked it up only as far as Malinga who only had his hat falling off to worry about in taking the catch

forward, then back, goes to cut and chops it on it was a ball flicked out of the front of the hand, went on with the angle from around the wicket and Morgan, rocking back to cut, has slashed it onto his middle stump and his promotion has failed. Probably too full a length to cut

not enough distance this time! Ballance tried to heave this from outside off over one of the long boundaries, but it came off the bottom of the bat and Chandimal had plenty of time to steady under the catch at deep midwicket

and that's gone as well! Went for the sweep and it struck him on the back leg. Only thing would have been outside the line and replays say it was! So a review would have saved Bopara, but he declined to use it.

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: first breakthrough! Went after a wide delivery, he moved across his crease to try and reach it, well away from his body and thin edge through to Sangakkara. He hadn't been offered much width and his eyes lit up
this time he's gone, goes down on on knee to sweep a back-of-the-hand slower ball and is taken on the knee roll. Having not advised Bopara to review he uses it himself but it's three reds

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alastair Cook c †Sangakkara b Kulasekara 11 (23b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 47.82

dismissalComment.html: first breakthrough! Went after a wide delivery, he moved across his crease to try and reach it, well away from his body and thin edge through to Sangakkara. He hadn't been offered much width and his eyes lit up

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalText.commentary: Ian Bell c Malinga b Mathews 50 (56b 4x4 1x6 88m) SR: 89.28

dismissalComment.html: another slower ball, Bell sits back for it and swings leg side but swings it straight to short long leg where Malinga takes an easy catch. A poor dismissal from Bell's point of view not getting the elevation on a ball that was there to hit but he picked it up only as far as Malinga who only had his hat falling off to worry about in taking the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Eoin Morgan b Senanayake 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: forward, then back, goes to cut and chops it on it was a ball flicked out of the front of the hand, went on with the angle from around the wicket and Morgan, rocking back to cut, has slashed it onto his middle stump and his promotion has failed. Probably too full a length to cut

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Gary Ballance c Chandimal b Senanayake 64 (72b 5x4 1x6 93m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: not enough distance this time! Ballance tried to heave this from outside off over one of the long boundaries, but it came off the bottom of the bat and Chandimal had plenty of time to steady under the catch at deep midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Ravi Bopara lbw b Senanayake 3 (6b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: and that's gone as well! Went for the sweep and it struck him on the back leg. Only thing would have been outside the line and replays say it was! So a review would have saved Bopara, but he declined to use it.

dismissalText.commentary: Joe Root lbw b Kulasekara 45 (41b 2x4 1x6 55m) SR: 109.75

dismissalComment.html: this time he's gone, goes down on on knee to sweep a back-of-the-hand slower ball and is taken on the knee roll. Having not advised Bopara to review he uses it himself but it's three reds

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Morgan b Tredwell 35 (41b 4x4 0x6 49m) SR: 85.36

dismissalComment.html: massive wicket! He tries to flick this through midwicket again but this time can't keep the ball down and picks out Eoin Morgan. Perhaps played a fraction early. The change of line worked. Another example of Tredwell's calmness and cool thinking under pressure

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Ballance b Jordan 33 (40b 5x4 0x6 60m) SR: 82.5

dismissalComment.html: full ball a foot outside off, Dilshan throws the kitchen sink at it having taken a few steps down the wicket and got a whirl of an outside edge to third man where Ballance holds a smart catch just in from the rope. A wild swipe from Dilshan, no control on that and perishes in the deep

full ball a foot outside off, Dilshan throws the kitchen sink at it having taken a few steps down the wicket and got a whirl of an outside edge to third man where Ballance holds a smart catch just in from the rope. A wild swipe from Dilshan, no control on that and perishes in the deep

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he edges this one! Short of a length, Chandimal heaves across the line aiming for the leg side boundary but just gets a thin top edge

and another...it's falling away for Sri Lanka. The shorter delivery works again. Back of a length, Kulasekara heaves to the leg side and gets a massive top edge which goes straight up, giving Buttler plenty of time to trot around and take his second catch of the over

massive wicket! He tries to flick this through midwicket again but this time can't keep the ball down and picks out Eoin Morgan. Perhaps played a fraction early. The change of line worked. Another example of Tredwell's calmness and cool thinking under pressure

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: he can't get three reverse sweeps away, though! Terrific catch by Cook. It looped off the top edge, he got too far underneath it this time, but Cook still had to run backwards a fair distance from short third man and took a well-judged catch coming over his shoulder
another neat catch, this time Root at long-on. Perera swinging like a rusty gate, it was a length delivery, and he picked out the deep fielder with pretty good accuracy

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne lbw b Anderson 0 (5b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: this now swings back in, much fuller, and beats the inside edge, huge cry for lbw and given out lbw it looked pretty good but Thirimanne reviews. He definitely hasn't hit it, is it too high? No. Hawk Eye has it taking a huge chunk of the bails and Sri Lanka lose an opener and a review. Classic Anderson, full and swinging and did for Thirimanne used to playing in Bangladesh recently

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara b Gurney 8 (13b 2x4 0x6 19m) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: full of length just outside off, Sangakkara pokes forward at it and drags it into his stumps and the pressure works for England. Poor stroke here, no foot movement at all from Sanakkara just looking to play it out on the off side, it shaped in a little and took a thick inside edge smack into middle and leg stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Ballance b Jordan 33 (40b 5x4 0x6 60m) SR: 82.5

dismissalComment.html: full ball a foot outside off, Dilshan throws the kitchen sink at it having taken a few steps down the wicket and got a whirl of an outside edge to third man where Ballance holds a smart catch just in from the rope. A wild swipe from Dilshan, no control on that and perishes in the deep

dismissalComment.html: massive wicket! He tries to flick this through midwicket again but this time can't keep the ball down and picks out Eoin Morgan. Perhaps played a fraction early. The change of line worked. Another example of Tredwell's calmness and cool thinking under pressure

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara c †Buttler b Jordan 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: and another...it's falling away for Sri Lanka. The shorter delivery works again. Back of a length, Kulasekara heaves to the leg side and gets a massive top edge which goes straight up, giving Buttler plenty of time to trot around and take his second catch of the over

headshotImage.caption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alastair Cook player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c Cook b Tredwell 18 (21b 2x4 0x6 34m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: he can't get three reverse sweeps away, though! Terrific catch by Cook. It looped off the top edge, he got too far underneath it this time, but Cook still had to run backwards a fair distance from short third man and took a well-judged catch coming over his shoulder

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Root b Tredwell 2 (6b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: another neat catch, this time Root at long-on. Perera swinging like a rusty gate, it was a length delivery, and he picked out the deep fielder with pretty good accuracy

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake c Bell b Gurney 11 (11b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: picks out long-on...Senanayake tried to send this length delivery into the stands but it didn't come out of the middle and it was a simple catch

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Bopara 10 (16b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: all over! The slower ball does the trick. Malinga giving himself room outside leg stump and misses his wild swing

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Bopara 10 (16b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 62.5

commentTextItems.html: all over! The slower ball does the trick. Malinga giving himself room outside leg stump and misses his wild swing

commentPostTextItems.html: A very efficient win for England by 81 runs on the D/L method. They constructed a good innings, despite having to restart after the rain, then defended it very well. Chris Jordan the star with bat and ball, but plenty of other good performances from the likes of Ian Bell, Gary Ballance and Harry Gurney. The early-season tonic England needed, but Sri Lanka can bounce back. It is only their second defeat in 20 matches, and both have been to England. I'll bring you news from the presentation shortly.

Angelo Mathews "It was a pretty poor performance, we were not up to the mark with the ball. It was an off day for them. A poor effort by the whole team. You can't control the weather, but we played some poor cricket. The wicket played pretty well. The confidence remains high, it's just one game."

Alastair Cook "It was very professional. Sometimes we though we had better of conditions and sometimes not. Everyone did well. Gary started really, we know what Jos can hit like and then Jordan as well. The lads played [Malinga] really well. Even the great bowlers can go the distance. That extra 30-runs made a big difference."

No surprises, the Man of the Match is Chris Jordan. "Just twisted by ankle a little but nothing serious. I enjoyed whacking the ball and bowling with some aggression. [The short ball] was something we spoke about after not finishing well the other night. It's nice to get one back on Malinga after the other night."
Well, that just about wraps things up from here. We'll be back on Sunday for the second match from Durham. Until then from Andrew McGlashan and Alex Winter it's goodbye and thanks for joining us.

commentTextItems.html: strikes the back as he goes to pull, the ball scoots through
missed stumping to add to Buttler's list...Malinga head in the air, swinging to leg, and he should really have taken that
misses his swing to leg, takes the pad
slower ball, drifts into the batsman, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
heaved down the ground to long-on

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: full outside off, powerfully driven past cover and wide of mid-off but Jordan is able to chase it down

commentPostTextItems.html: Jordan hobbling after that chase, he appeared to slip near the boundary. That would be an awful way to end such a fine evening

commentTextItems.html: full at the stumps, defended

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake c Bell b Gurney 11 (11b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 100

commentTextItems.html: picks out long-on...Senanayake tried to send this length delivery into the stands but it didn't come out of the middle and it was a simple catch
that's a good delivery, full outside off, beats the edge
and he's overstepped again! This is careless. Takes a thick inside edge down to fine leg
lets himself down a little by overstepping, gets clubbed into midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: Harry Gurney back into the attack

commentTextItems.html: round the wicket, slower ball outside off, beats the outside edge
takes the pad as he swings to leg
dropped in his followthrough, it was hammered back by Malinga and caught Bopara by surprise, although he did have his eyes on it. Good test for a dodgy finger
driven to deep cover
a full slower ball outside off, lofted into the off side and falls into space
short and angled into the pads, pulled backward of square and despite getting to the ball Anderson can't flick the ball back
driven firmly back and well fielded, diving to his left, by Bopara
nearly bowls him...Malinga goes well outside off stump, it's a length delivery, he misses his swing but the ball carries over the timber

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sachithra Senanayake c Bell b Gurney 11 (11b 1x4 0x6 23m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: picks out long-on...Senanayake tried to send this length delivery into the stands but it didn't come out of the middle and it was a simple catch

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Bopara 10 (16b 1x4 0x6 20m) SR: 62.5

dismissalComment.html: all over! The slower ball does the trick. Malinga giving himself room outside leg stump and misses his wild swing

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal not out 4 (5b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: this now swings back in, much fuller, and beats the inside edge, huge cry for lbw and given out lbw it looked pretty good but Thirimanne reviews. He definitely hasn't hit it, is it too high? No. Hawk Eye has it taking a huge chunk of the bails and Sri Lanka lose an opener and a review. Classic Anderson, full and swinging and did for Thirimanne used to playing in Bangladesh recently

headshotImage.caption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harry Gurney player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full of length just outside off, Sangakkara pokes forward at it and drags it into his stumps and the pressure works for England. Poor stroke here, no foot movement at all from Sanakkara just looking to play it out on the off side, it shaped in a little and took a thick inside edge smack into middle and leg stumps
picks out long-on...Senanayake tried to send this length delivery into the stands but it didn't come out of the middle and it was a simple catch

full ball a foot outside off, Dilshan throws the kitchen sink at it having taken a few steps down the wicket and got a whirl of an outside edge to third man where Ballance holds a smart catch just in from the rope. A wild swipe from Dilshan, no control on that and perishes in the deep

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he edges this one! Short of a length, Chandimal heaves across the line aiming for the leg side boundary but just gets a thin top edge

and another...it's falling away for Sri Lanka. The shorter delivery works again. Back of a length, Kulasekara heaves to the leg side and gets a massive top edge which goes straight up, giving Buttler plenty of time to trot around and take his second catch of the over
all over! The slower ball does the trick. Malinga giving himself room outside leg stump and misses his wild swing

massive wicket! He tries to flick this through midwicket again but this time can't keep the ball down and picks out Eoin Morgan. Perhaps played a fraction early. The change of line worked. Another example of Tredwell's calmness and cool thinking under pressure

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: he can't get three reverse sweeps away, though! Terrific catch by Cook. It looped off the top edge, he got too far underneath it this time, but Cook still had to run backwards a fair distance from short third man and took a well-judged catch coming over his shoulder
another neat catch, this time Root at long-on. Perera swinging like a rusty gate, it was a length delivery, and he picked out the deep fielder with pretty good accuracy

A wild swipe from Dilshan, no control on that and perishes in the deep

notes: England innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 39 runs, 1 wicket)
England: 50 runs in 11.3 overs (69 balls), Extras 1
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 59 balls (IR Bell 26, GS Ballance 24, Ex 0)
Drinks: England - 91/1 in 17.0 overs (IR Bell 47, GS Ballance 30)
England: 100 runs in 19.3 overs (117 balls), Extras 3
IR Bell: 50 off 52 balls (4 x 4, 1 x 6)
Over 20.1: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - RJ Bailey, Batsman - IR Bell (Struck down)
Rain: England - 101/2 in 20.4 overs (GS Ballance 37)
GS Ballance: 50 off 62 balls (4 x 4)
England: 150 runs in 30.5 overs (185 balls), Extras 3
Over 35.3: Review by England (Batting), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - JE Root (Struck down)
England: 200 runs in 35.6 overs (216 balls), Extras 5
Powerplay 2: Overs 37.1 - 39.0 (Batting side - 38 runs, 0 wicket)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 21 balls (JC Buttler 14, CJ Jordan 38, Ex 2)
Innings Break: England - 247/6 in 39.0 overs (JC Buttler 26, CJ Jordan 38)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory)
Over 0.5: Review by Sri Lanka (Batting), Umpire - RJ Bailey, Batsman - HDRL Thirimanne (Struck down)
Rain: Sri Lanka 60/2 in 13.3 overs (TM Dilshan 32, DPMD Jayawardene 16)

milestones.description: Ian Bell has scored 34 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ENG breaking Pietersen's record

stories.title: England v Sri Lanka, 2014
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, The Oval

stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, England v Sri Lanka, 2014

stories.title: How it went at The Oval
stories.seoTitle: Alan Tyers: How it went at The Oval
stories.summary: The ECB debriefs phase one of Operation United Marching Forward Together Going Forward

image.caption: Kevin Pietersen and Dinesh Karthik shared a 71-run partnership
image.longCaption: Kevin Pietersen and Dinesh Karthik shared a 71-run partnership, Delhi Daredevils v Kings XI Punjab, IPL 2014, Delhi, May 19, 2014

stories.title: Only the start of the short stuff
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: Only the start of the short stuff
stories.summary: Sri Lanka's bowlers had propelled their World T20 campaign, often bailing out lacklustre batting displays, but when the bowlers had a bad evening in London, the batsmen could not reciprocate

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan slapped his way to 33 but took 40 balls to do so
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan slapped his way to 33 but took 40 balls to do so, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, May 22, 2014

stories.title: All-round Jordan brings a smile back to England
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.seoTitle: All-round Chris Jordan brings a smile back to England
stories.summary: A superb all-round performance from Chris Jordan, who smashed 38 off 13 balls then took three wickets, spearheaded England's 81-run win against Sri Lanka

image.caption: Chris Jordan followed his lively batting with excellent bowling
image.longCaption: Chris Jordan followed his lively batting with excellent bowling, England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval, May 22, 2014

stories.title: Fans' goodwill remains - Cook
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.summary: Alastair Cook believes the English public remain largely behind the team despite the events of the winter and its dramatic fallout.

image.caption: Alastair Cook and Ian Bell head out to bat
image.longCaption: Alastair Cook and Ian Bell head out to bat, Scotland v England, only ODI, Aberdeen, May 9, 2014

stories.title: Mathews wary of England, conditions
stories.subTitle: England v Sri Lanka, 1st ODI, The Oval
stories.summary: Angelo Mathews marked out key England players and foreign conditions as the primary threats as Sri Lanka embarks on a five-match series

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan flayed an 18-ball half-century

videos.title: 'You'd put your mortgage on Chris Jordan'

videos.summary: England have found the beginnings of an exciting new young ODI team, says George Dobell after the convincing win over Sri Lanka at The Oval.
